definition: firefighting/to extinguish a fire and save life and property/to dive (of goalkeeper in soccer)
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over

sentences.english: Twice went close to scoring, forcing excellent saves out of Tzorvas.
sentences.chinese: 两次与进球擦肩而过，迫使佐尔瓦斯做出精彩扑救。

sentences.english: I rushed to the squadron fire officers and soldiers rushed to the scene and started a fire fight.
sentences.chinese: 我中队消防官兵火速赶往现场并展开了火灾扑救。

sentences.english: Before it was just being in the six-yard box saving shots.
sentences.chinese: 之前他们只是在六码区域内扑救。

sentences.english: I spent this summer fighting forest fires.
sentences.chinese: 这个夏季我在扑救森林大火。

sentences.english: Blade regiment several times, but nearly will also save himself falling.
sentences.chinese: 刀锋贪生怕死几次扑救，却险些也将本人堕入。

sentences.english: When an erosive material catches fire, it should be put out with water cannon.
sentences.chinese: 腐蚀品着火时，可用水柱直接喷射扑救。

sentences.english: To be fair Brad Friedel made two fantastic saves at least.
sentences.chinese: 弗里德尔至少做了2次以上的精彩扑救。

sentences.english: Zeng Cheng made an attractive saving goal, Deng Xiaofei on the scene side applauds straight.
sentences.chinese: 曾诚做一个漂亮的扑救，邓小飞在场边直叫好。

sentences.english: He had many good saves so far and strikers can not pass through.
sentences.chinese: 他多次做出精彩扑救，前锋们望之兴叹。

sentences.english: First against Denmark, Fabien Barthez saved us several times.
sentences.chinese: 对丹麦比赛里，巴特兹多次精彩扑救。

sentences.english: In fire environments, the traditional fire extinguishing agents can't effectually put out a fire which is sheltered by barrier.
sentences.chinese: 传统水喷淋灭火系统很难扑救有障碍物遮挡的火焰。

definition: (soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
